message:
mysql> INSERT INTO auth_permission (name, content_type_id, codename) VALUES ('Can add chart message thread', 321, 'add_chartmessagethread');
ERROR 1452 (23000): Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`el8_master_inno`.`auth_permission`, CONSTRAINT `content_type_id_refs_id_728de91f` FOREIGN KEY (`content_type_id`) REFERENCES `django_content_type` (`id`))
mysql> select * from django_content_type where id=321;
+-----+----------------------+-----------+--------------------+
| id  | name                 | app_label | model              |
+-----+----------------------+-----------+--------------------+
| 321 | chart message thread | messaging | chartmessagethread |
+-----+----------------------+-----------+--------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
Had a migration fail, and ran into this conundrum. Not something I've experienced before..
@phil I believe this happens when you start mixing MySQL storage engines (MyISAM and InnoDB.
@phil Are you using South for your migrations?
@eron_v ... woah, yeah. the django_content_type table is MyISAM created.. though the rest of my tables aren't :P
